Sentencas: Rare-earth orthoferrites, REFeO3 (RE = rare earth; Y), are tremendously adaptable compounds that are being investigated for use in a wide variety of applications including gas sensors, vehicle catalytic converters, and solid-oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: An x-ray absorption spectroscopic study of the electronic structure and bonding of rare-earth orthoferrites

Sentencas: They also exhibit interesting magnetic properties such as high-temperature antiferromagnetism, making them useful for data storage applications.
Titulo: An x-ray absorption spectroscopic study of the electronic structure and bonding of rare-earth orthoferrites

Sentencas: The compounds adopt a distorted perovskite-type structure where the tilt angle of the octahedra increases (Fe-O-Fe bond angle decreases) as the size of the rare-earth atom decreases.
Titulo: An x-ray absorption spectroscopic study of the electronic structure and bonding of rare-earth orthoferrites

Sentencas: Despite intensive study of the physical properties of these compounds, very few studies have investigated how the bonding and electronic structure of these systems change with substitution of the RE. X-ray absorption near-edge spectroscopy (XANES) is a technique well-suited for such a study, and, in view of this, Fe L-, Fe K- and O K-edge spectra from a series of REFeO3 compounds (RE = La, Pr, Nd, Sm, Eu, Gd, Ho, Yb, Y) have been collected, and are presented here.
Titulo: An x-ray absorption spectroscopic study of the electronic structure and bonding of rare-earth orthoferrites

Sentencas: Fe L-edge spectra show that Fe is octahedrally coordinated and that the Fe-centered octahedra do not appear to distort with changes in the identity of the RE.
Titulo: An x-ray absorption spectroscopic study of the electronic structure and bonding of rare-earth orthoferrites

Sentencas: The Fe K-edge spectra contain an intersite hybrid peak, which is an ill-studied feature that is attributed to non-local transitions of 1s electrons to 3d states on the next-nearest-neighbor atom that are hybridized with 4p states on the absorbing atom through O 2p states.
Titulo: An x-ray absorption spectroscopic study of the electronic structure and bonding of rare-earth orthoferrites

Sentencas: In this study, it is shown that the intensity of this feature is strongly dependent on the Fe-O-Fe bond angle; the lower the Fe-O-Fe bond angle, the less intense the intersite hybrid peak is.
Titulo: An x-ray absorption spectroscopic study of the electronic structure and bonding of rare-earth orthoferrites
